member.summary: A confidence measure from 0.0 to 1.0 of whether the track is acoustic

member.summary: An HTTP URL to access the full audio analysis of this track

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Danceability
member.summary: Danceability describes how suitable a track is for dancing based on a combination of musical elements including tempo, rhythm stability, beat strength, and overall regularity. A value of 0.0 is least danceable and 1.0 is most danceable

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Duration
member.summary: The duration of the track in milliseconds

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Energy
member.summary: Energy is a measure from 0.0 to 1.0 and represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Instrumentalness
member.summary: Predicts whether a track contains no vocals. â€œOohâ€ and â€œaahâ€ sounds are treated as instrumental in this context. Rap or spoken word tracks are clearly â€œvocalâ€. The closer the instrumentalness value is to 1.0, the greater likelihood the track contains no vocal content. Values above 0.5 are intended to represent instrumental tracks, but confidence is higher as the value approaches 1.0

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Key
member.summary: The key the track is in. Integers map to pitches using standard Pitch Class notation.

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Liveness
member.summary: Detects the presence of an audience in the recording. Higher liveness values represent an increased probability that the track was performed live. A value above 0.8 provides strong likelihood that the track is live

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Loudness
member.summary: The overall loudness of a track in decibels (dB). Loudness values are averaged across the entire track and are useful for comparing relative loudness of tracks. Loudness is the quality of a sound that is the primary psychological correlate of physical strength (amplitude). Values typical range between -60 and 0 db

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Mode
member.summary: Mode indicates the modality(major or minor) of a track, the type of scale from which its melodic content is derived. Major is represented by 1 and minor is 0

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Speechiness
member.summary: Speechiness detects the presence of spoken words in a track. The more exclusively speech-like the recording (e.g. talk show, audio book, poetry), the closer to 1.0 the attribute value. Values above 0.66 describe tracks that are probably made entirely of spoken words. Values between 0.33 and 0.66 describe tracks that may contain both music and speech, either in sections or layered, including such cases as rap music. Values below 0.33 most likely represent music and other non-speech-like tracks

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Tempo
member.summary: The overall estimated tempo of a track in beats per minute (BPM). In musical terminology, tempo is the speed or pace of a given piece and derives directly from the average beat duration

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.TimeSignature
member.summary: An estimated overall time signature of a track. The time signature (meter) is a notational convention to specify how many beats are in each bar (or measure)

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.TrackHref
member.summary: A link to the Web API endpoint providing full details of the track

member.name: P:Spotify.NetStandard.Sdk.AudioFeaturesResponse.Valence
member.summary: A measure from 0.0 to 1.0 describing the musical positiveness conveyed by a track. Tracks with high valence sound more positive (e.g. happy, cheerful, euphoric), while tracks with low valence sound more negative (e.g. sad, depressed, angry)

member.summary: Energy percentage from 0% to 100% represents a perceptual measure of intensity and activity

Timestamps are returned in ISO 8601 format as Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) with a zero offset: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SSZ. If the time is imprecise (for example, the date/time of an show release), an additional field indicates the precision; see for example, ReleaseDate in a show object.
